New Records: Virat Kohli became the first player to hit 50 ODI centuries, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's record.
Mohammed Shami took 7 wickets for 57 runs, the most by an Indian bowler in a World Cup semi-final.
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer scored 105 off 67 balls, the fastest century in an ODI semi-final.
Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell's partnership of 132 was New Zealand's highest in an ODI.
Mohammed Shami dismissed Trent Boult and Glenn Phillips to complete a five-wicket haul.
Pre-Game Insights: Virat Kohli expressed pride in his achievement and the team's effort.
India's undefeated run in the World Cup highlighted their strong performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson praised India's performance and acknowledged their dominance.
India will face either Australia or South Africa in the final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was described as challenging, with variable bounce.
The match set a new record for the highest total in an ODI semi-final.
Others: The live updates and related stories provided additional context about the match and the World Cup.
